summary: This document appears to be a collection of text message exchanges from December 2019, discussing communication attempts and scheduling with an unnamed victim or witness. The messages reference feelings of being 'robbed' and mention other victims, suggesting coordination or support among individuals affected by the Epstein case.

events.title: Victim describes emotional state
events.description: An unnamed individual responds to a message, stating they are 'doing okay' but feel 'robbed,' and notes this is the 'second time around' while mentioning many other victims.

events.title: Scheduling attempt for Saturday meeting
events.description: A conversation is referenced to schedule a meeting for Saturday at noon, with a contact number to be forwarded.

events.title: Contact number provided
events.description: A message is sent providing a contact number, likely related to the scheduled meeting.

events.title: Rescheduling due to time zone confusion
events.description: Messages discuss rescheduling a call due to mountain time confusion, with references to a baby's sleep schedule and checking availability.

keyFacts: The document contains text messages from 2019 discussing communication with a victim who feels 'robbed' and mentions 'many other victims.'
Messages indicate attempts to schedule meetings or calls in July and August 2019, with references to time zone coordination and availability.
The victim describes the situation as the 'second time around,' suggesting prior legal or investigative proceedings related to the Epstein case.
All personal names in the messages appear to be redacted or omitted, indicated by placeholders like 'Conversation with''' and incomplete references.
